title: Supporting dark mode
---

Subframe doesn't currently support both light & dark mode per theme, but you can implement it in your codebase using CSS variables. This guide shows you how to set up dark mode using CSS variables and Tailwind's dark mode support.
=======
title: Dark mode
description: Implement dark mode in your codebase using CSS variables and Tailwind's dark mode support.
---

Subframe doesn't have built-in dark mode support, but you can implement it in your codebase using CSS variables. This approach gives you full control over dark mode colors while keeping your Subframe theme as the source of truth for light mode.
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)

## Prerequisites

Before setting up dark mode, ensure you have:
<<<<<<< HEAD
- [Installed Subframe](/installation) in your project
- [Synced your components and theme](/developing/syncing-components) to your codebase

## How it works

1. Configure Tailwind to use CSS variables instead of hardcoded colors
2. Define light mode colors from your Subframe theme as CSS variables
=======
- [Installed Subframe](/installation/existing-project) in your project
- [Synced your components and theme](/develop/syncing-components) to your codebase

## How it works

The strategy is to:

1. Configure Tailwind to use CSS variables instead of hardcoded colors
2. Define light mode colors (from your Subframe theme) as CSS variables
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)
3. Define dark mode color overrides under an `html.dark` selector
4. Toggle between modes by adding/removing the `dark` class on the HTML element

This keeps your Subframe workflow unchanged while enabling dark mode in your application.

## Step 1: Configure Tailwind for CSS variables

<Tabs>
<Tab title="Tailwind v3">

<Note>Add `// @subframe/sync-disable` at the top to prevent Subframe from overwriting your changes.</Note>
=======
Modify your `tailwind.config.js` to use CSS variables. Add `// @subframe/sync-disable` at the top to prevent Subframe from overwriting your changes.
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)

```js tailwind.config.js {1, 3}
// @subframe/sync-disable
module.exports = {
  darkMode: "selector", // Enable class-based dark mode
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        brand: {
          50: "var(--brand-50)",
          100: "var(--brand-100)",
          // ... rest of your brand colors as CSS variables
        },
        neutral: {
          0: "var(--neutral-0)",
          50: "var(--neutral-50)",
          // ... rest of your neutral colors
        },
        // Continue for error, warning, success, etc.
        "brand-primary": "var(--brand-primary)",
        "default-font": "var(--default-font)",
        "subtext-color": "var(--subtext-color)",
        "neutral-border": "var(--neutral-border)",
        white: "var(--white)",
        "default-background": "var(--default-background)",
      },
    },
  },
}
```

<Tab title="Tailwind v4">

Modify your `theme.css` to use CSS variables and add the dark mode custom variant:

```css theme.css {1-3, 295}
@theme {
  /* Replace hardcoded colors with CSS variables */
  --color-brand-50: var(--brand-50);
  --color-brand-100: var(--brand-100);
  /* ... continue for all colors */

  /* Keep fonts, shadows, borders, spacing as-is */
}

/* Enable dark mode */
@custom-variant dark (&:where(.dark, .dark *));
```

```css variables.css
  --brand-50: rgb(23, 23, 23);

```

<Tip>
Dark mode colors typically invert the scale: light mode's `--brand-50` (lightest) becomes dark mode's `--brand-900` (darkest), and vice versa.
</Tip>

## Step 4: Toggle dark mode

Add or remove the `dark` class on the `<html>` element to switch themes.

### Next.js with next-themes

```bash
npm install next-themes
```

```tsx app/layout.tsx
import { ThemeProvider } from 'next-themes'

export default function RootLayout({ children }) {
  return (
    <html suppressHydrationWarning>
      <body>
        <ThemeProvider attribute="class" defaultTheme="system">
          {children}
        </ThemeProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  )
}
```

### React with context

```tsx ThemeProvider.tsx
import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react'

const ThemeContext = createContext({ theme: 'light', toggleTheme: () => {} })

export function ThemeProvider({ children }) {
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState('light')

  useEffect(() => {
    const root = window.document.documentElement
    root.classList.remove('light', 'dark')
    root.classList.add(theme)
  }, [theme])

  const toggleTheme = () => setTheme(theme === 'light' ? 'dark' : 'light')

  return (
    <ThemeContext.Provider value={{ theme, toggleTheme }}>
      {children}
    </ThemeContext.Provider>
  )
}

export const useTheme = () => useContext(ThemeContext)
```

### Theme toggle button

```tsx
import { useTheme } from 'next-themes'

export function ThemeToggle() {
  const { theme, setTheme } = useTheme()

  return (
    <button onClick={() => setTheme(theme === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark')}>
      {theme === 'dark' ? '‚òÄÔ∏è' : 'üåô'}
    </button>
  )
}
```

### Test in both modes
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)

Always test your application in both light and dark modes. Check for:
- Sufficient contrast ratios (use browser DevTools)
- Readability of all text
- Visibility of borders and dividers
- Proper styling of interactive states

### Prevent flash of unstyled content
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)

Set the theme before React hydrates to prevent flashing:

```tsx _document.tsx
<script dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: `
    (function() {
      const theme = localStorage.getItem('theme') || 'light';
      document.documentElement.classList.add(theme);
    })()
  `
}} />
```

## Troubleshooting

### Colors not switching

Ensure you're:
1. Adding the `dark` class to `<html>`, not a child element
2. Using CSS variable-based colors in your components
3. Configuring Tailwind with `darkMode: "selector"` (v3) or the custom variant (v4)

### Flash on page load

Add the theme script before React hydrates (see "Prevent flash" above).

### Styles not applying

Verify your `variables.css` is imported before Tailwind and that the path is correct.
>>>>>>> 46db3f4 (rebase)
